page.title: 08The River Stour
page.content:
Since William the Conqueror's time, the river has been important to Sudbury for moving wool, grain and other goods. The Mill Hotel, with its working wheel is a conversion of one of the old river mills. The grazing land beside the river is largely unchanged since "Domesday" times and is technically still owned by the families named in the great book. The river and land is under a conservation order by Babergh D C with a river manager, Mr Black. A dismantled railway line runs along the river and has been converted to a public way called "The Valley Walk" Sudbury Rowing Club, the only one in Suffolk, have used the river for their sport for over 50 years.
By: Class 4. St.Joseph's RCVA Primary.
